media:group.media:title: Fleet Foxes - "Silver Dagger" (Solstice Version)
media:group.media:description:
"Silver Dagger" (Solstice Version) by @Fleet Foxes from the album 'A Very Lonely Solstice', available now
Stream & download: https://fleetfoxes.ffm.to/averylonelysolstice

Available for the first time since 2020's Winter Solstice Recording at Brooklyn's St. Ann & The Holy Trinity Church. Watch The Full Performance: https://youtu.be/3VB24LYsE60

Lyrics

Don't sing love songs, you’ll wake my mother
She's sleeping here, right by my side
And in her right hand, a silver dagger
She says that I can't be your bride

"All men are false," said my mother
"They’ll tell you wicked, loving lies
And the very next evening, they'll court another
Leave you alone to pine and sigh"

My daddy, he's a handsome devil
He's got a chain five miles long
And on every link, a heart does dangle
Of another maid he's loved and wronged

So court another tender maiden
And hope that she will be your wife
For I have been warned and I've decided
To sleep alone all of my life
